articles.title: 'Oracle, It‚Äôs Time to Free JavaScript.'
articles.description: It‚Äôs long been a bone of contention that Oracle owns the trademark for ‚ÄòJavaScript‚Äô (we put out a call two years ago) but this marks the first serious effort to try and change that, including petitioning the USPTO, if necessary. You can support the effort by signing this open letter, joining a vast array of JavaScript luminaries.
articles.author: The JavaScript Community

articles.title: Now You Can Compile and Run C in JavaScript
articles.description: Well, if you‚Äôre using Bun, at least. Bun v1.1.28 lands experimental support for compiling and native C code and then running its functions from JavaScript. It's easier than it sounds..
articles.author: Jarred Sumner (Bun)

articles.title: ts-blank-space: Fast Type-Stripping TypeScript to JS Compiler
articles.description: It‚Äôs job is simple: be the fastest TS to JS compiler written in JS (it‚Äôs 5.6x faster than tsc.) Types are simply replaced with whitespace preserving the coordinates of the JS code which eliminates the need for sourcemaps entirely.
articles.author: Ashley Claymore / Bloomberg

articles.title: Mathematical Symbols and JavaScript Equivalents
articles.description: We‚Äôre not just talking the obvious like + and - but things like ‚Åø‚àö, Œ£, Œ†, ‚àÉ, and set notation.
articles.author: Joshua Nussbaum

articles.title: A React 19 Cheat Sheet
articles.description: From Kent C Dodds, of Epic React fame, comes this part cheat sheet, part succinct reminder of some of the new things you can do in React 19, along with (very) brief code examples.
articles.author: Kent C. Dodds

articles.title: From Parcel to Vite: A Short Story of a 100K LOC Migration
articles.description: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve migrated our frontend projects from Parcel to Vite, and the process was‚Ä¶ smooth.‚Äù
articles.author: Gao / Logto

articles.title: How to Create a Chrome Extension with React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS and Vite
articles.description: Covers everything you need to know right through to publishing in the Chrome Web Store.
articles.author: Lokman Musliu

articles.title: date-fns v4.0 Released with First-Class Time Zones Support
articles.description: date-fns is a hugely popular and comprehensive suite of 200+ functions for working with dates in JavaScript, and now there‚Äôs first-class time zone support too.
articles.author: Sasha Koss

articles.title: ts-remove-unused: Remove Unused Code from TypeScript Projects
articles.description: A tool that can auto-fix unused exports (removing export from the declaration or the whole declaration based on its usage) and delete modules that have no referenced exports. Knip is another mature tool in this space, though focused more on detecting the things you can remove.
articles.author: LINE

articles.title: Next.js SaaS Starter: A Next.js Template for SaaS Webapps
articles.description: A starter template for building a SaaS-style webapp using Next.js with authentication, Stripe integration, and a dashboard for users. It uses Postgres and Drizzle for the database and UI elements based on shadcn/ui and Tailwind.
articles.author: Lee Robinson (Vercel)

articles.title: nano-spawn: Tiny Execa-Inspired Process Execution for Node.js
articles.description: If you‚Äôre familiar with Sindre‚Äôs Execa for running commands from a Node app in a reliable manner, nano-spawn offers its core functionality in a smaller package.
articles.author: Sindre Sorhus and ehmicky

articles.title: DECK.GL: GPU-Powered Large-Scale Data Visualization Framework
articles.description: Well suited to geospatial data visualization use cases that go beyond typical 2D views. There are plenty of examples to show it off. Can be used through both vanilla JS and React interfaces.
articles.author: OpenJS Foundation

articles.title: Vue-Multiselect 3.1: A Complete 'Selecting Solution' for Vue.js
articles.description: There‚Äôs a lot on offer here, complete with SSR support, Vuex support, strong test coverage, and with no dependencies.
articles.author: Damian Dulisz et al.

articles.title: Chokidar 4.0: Efficient Cross-Platform File Watching Node.js Library
articles.description: Wraps around fs.watch / fs.watchFile and normalizes the events received, applies best practices, and presents an API that works the same across platforms.
articles.author: Paul Miller

articles.description: üèÜ Developer analyst firm RedMonk has put out a Q3 2024 ranking of programming languages with JavaScript happily in first place.
üì∫ Honeypot has released a nine minute documentary where Ryan Dahl (the original creator of Node.js) and Bert Belder ‚ñ∂Ô∏è tell the story of how Deno began.
Talking of Deno, Deno 2.0 is expected to be released tomorrow.
üß≠ Alongside new releases of macOS, iOS, and iPadOS, Safari 18 has been released. Alongside numerous Web API enhancements, its JS regex support has been enhanced when it comes to Unicode.
üî• David Bushell tried JSR ‚Äì he didn't like it.
Fastify v5 ‚Äì Fastify is a popular, perf-focused web framework for Node.js, inspired by Express (which recently reached v5.0 too!)
Astro 5 Beta ‚Äì Astro helps keep the run of v5.0 releases going..

Node.js v22.9 (Current) ‚Äì Adds a util.getCallSite function to obtain the stacktrace of the current execution. V8's Maglev JIT is also disabled for reliability reasons due to outstanding issues in V8.
Hono 4.6 ‚Äì The nifty 'any runtime' webapp framework gains context storage middleware.

articles.title: WebKit Features in Safari 18.0
articles.description: Safari 18 arrives alongside iOS 18 and macOS Sequoia, along with 53 new web platform features. This new version of Apple‚Äôs browser has some interesting features, such as the ability to hide ‚Äòdistracting‚Äô items from a web page, new iPhone Mirroring and remote inspection options, and it joins Chrome in supporting View Transitions and Style Queries when testing CSS Custom Properties.
articles.author: Jen Simmons

articles.title: Optimizing for High Latency Environments
articles.description: If you‚Äôve a particular interest or responsibility in diving deep into performance metrics, then this detailed post from Harry on round-trip-time (RTT) should prove invaluable.
articles.author: Harry Roberts

articles.title: 'In 2024, Just 0.5% of the Global Top 200 Websites Use Valid HTML'
articles.description: Jens digs into some of the rather woeful findings from the latest HTML conformance data and urges us to ship valid HTML.
articles.author: Jens Oliver Meiert

articles.title: Astro 5.0 Beta Release
articles.description: The first beta release of Astro 5.0, the popular web framework is now available. This new release includes the now stable Astro Content Layer, along with stable server islands, a new way to mix static and personalized content.
articles.author: Astro

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†The ‚ÄúOther‚Äù C in CSS
articles.description: A practical, technical hour-long talk from this year's CSS Day conference about accessibility, and how CSS affects the semantic accessibility of our HTML.
articles.author: Sara Soueidan

articles.title: How to Animate to height: auto (and Other Intrinsic Sizing Keywords)
articles.description: An often requested CSS feature is the ability to animate to height: auto and CSS‚Äôs interpolate-size property and the calc-size() function provide a way to do this, though it‚Äôs limited to Chrome 129+ for now.
articles.author: Bramus (Chrome)

articles.title: The State of ES5 on the Web
articles.description: Early JavaScript build tools often focused on allowing modern features to be used on the Web at the time by compiling down to ES5 code that could run anywhere. Time has moved on, but have the tools or popular libraries? Philip investigates, and shares some recommendations.
articles.author: Philip Walton

articles.title: Logical Properties in Size Queries
articles.description: ‚ÄúWe may need size-based media queries for some time yet, and being able to use logical properties with them would certainly be useful‚Äù.
articles.author: Michelle Barker

articles.title: üò¢¬†The Continuing Tragedy of Emoji on the Web
articles.description: Nolan laments ‚Äúhow half-heartedly browsers and operating systems have worked to keep their emoji up to date‚Äù.
articles.author: Nolan Lawson

articles.title: Two CSS Properties for Trimming Text Box Whitespace
articles.description: Specifically, text-box-trim and text-box-edge, two fine-grain properties to trim specific amounts of whitespace around text. Support is limited, and only behind a feature flag for now.
articles.author: Daniel Schwarz

articles.title: Let‚Äôs Bring Back Browsing
articles.description: ‚ÄúTo ‚Äúsurf the web‚Äù implied fun and adventure and to ‚Äúbrowse‚Äù implied serendipity. And we seem to have lost that. Let‚Äôs go back‚Äù.
articles.author: Christian Heilmann

articles.title: The First HTML LSP That Reports Syntax Errors
articles.description: A new Language Server for HTML that catches various syntax errors (either in popular editors such as VSCode or as a CLI tool). It claims to deliver immediate feedback on HTML errors, and common typos.
articles.author: Loris Cro

articles.title: @bramus/caniuse-cli: A CLI Tool for ‚ÄúCan I Use‚Äù
articles.description: Bramus has built an (offline) command line tool for the always useful Can I Use and MDN‚Äôs browser-compat-data. The npm package is here. Once installed, use caniuse at the command line to query. Handy!
articles.author: Bramus Van Damme

articles.title: DECK.GL: GPU-Powered Large-Scale Data Visualization Framework
articles.description: Particularly well suited to geospatial data visualization use cases that go beyond typical 2D views. There are plenty of examples to show you what it can do. Can be used through both vanilla JS and React interfaces.
articles.author: OpenJS Foundation

articles.title: Free Public APIs: A Collection of Free Public APIs for Developers
articles.description: Categorized and searchable, these are tested daily via bots so if any API is taken down or moved behind a paywall, it gets removed from the site.
articles.author: Nick Schneeberger

articles.title: AIEditor: A Next-Generation Rich Text Editor with AI Features
articles.description: Based on Web Components so it can be integrated with any framework, has real-time collab, Markdown-friendly, and includes AI capabilities like spelling/grammar checks, one-click translation, and more. (LGPL licensed with a 'pro' option.)
articles.author: AIEditor

articles.title: 11ty-Serene: A Minimal Landing Page Theme for Eleventy
articles.description: Styled with Tailwind and includes scroll-reveal effects. (Eleventy / 11ty is a popular Node.js-powered static site generator.)
articles.author: Kevin Zhong
